alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:19AM EST until December 18 at 4:34PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Chester Creek Near Chester affecting Delaware County. For the Chester Creek...including Chester...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chester Creek near Chester. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, The creek floods adjacent open land. At 10.5 feet, Flood damage, adjacent to the creek, begins in the city of Chester. At 11.5 feet, Parker and Kerlin Streets flood. The 600 to 1300 blocks of Parker Street are subject to evacuations. The 1300-1400 blocks of Kerlin Street are also subject to evacuations. At 12.5 feet, The Parker Manor section of Chester is subject to evacuations. At 13.0 feet, Chester Creek Road floods in Brookhaven Borough. Closures are possible between Dutton Mill Road and Bridgewater Road. Mt. Alverno Road between Middletown and Aston is closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:47 AM EST Monday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:47 AM EST Monday was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this morning to 3.1 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 04/02/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (5 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Chester Creek Chester 8.0 11.7 Mon 4 am 3.1 MSG 12.2 6am 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 445 PM EST.
